news.title: It’s a generational consensus – says Mliswa, as he likens Tagwirei to Chamisa
news.content:
claims Zanu PF has decided on Tagwirei as next President ahead of Chiwenga

By Leopold Munhende

ZANU PF is now behind the future candidature of businessman Kudakwashe Tagwirei, outspoken former legislator Temba Mliswa has sensationally claimed.

Speaking to journalist Violet Gonda, Mliswa likened Tagwireis fast-track promotion to opposition leader Nelson Chamisa, describing it in similar terms that were used when the latter took over after the passing of pro-democracy icon Morgan Tsvangirai a generational consensus.

An ongoing factional fight within Zanu PF has pitted President Emmerson Mnangagwas deputy, Constantino Chiwenga with Tagwirei.

The two are in a race to succeed Mnangagwa, either in 2028 or beyond, if his term is illegally extended as is being rallied for by sections in the party.

That Tagwirei has become a strong contender is no longer secret, even hardline critics of the businessman such as Zanu PF spokesperson Christopher Mutsvangwa, have changed their stance.

Mliswa said it was time senior party members allowed younger members to take over.

It is a generational consensus just like when we had national consensus in making sure that people marched (in 2017). It is the generational consensus that Tagwirei must make it because he is young, said Mliswa.

We have given our liberators time to liberate us from an economic point of view but they have not done what we expected them to do, they have done their best but it is about time that we took over.

We do not have liberation history but we have economic ability to be able to transform the country and equally transform its fortunes.

Mliswa, who was fired from Zanu PF in 2015, has emerged as one of Tagwireis fervent supporters, frequently laying into Chiwenga.

Chiwenga is pushing for Tagwireis arrest on a string of corruption allegations. His attempts to get the partys stamp, however, fell by the wayside as he was advised to report all of the alleged graft to Zimbabwe Anti-Corruption Commission (ZACC) or the police.

Tagwireis meteoric rise is being supported by claims that he financed the 2017 coup that toppled late leader Robert Mugabe and governments agriculture programme, Command Agriculture.

Added Mliswa: It is a generational consensus which you cannot stop.

That is the reason why the opposition moved from the late Morgan Tsvangirai to Nelson Chamisa. Now Zanu PF has moved to Tagwirei.

news.title: Chipezeze the hero as Magesi falls to Orlando Pirates
news.content:
By Sports Reporter

Warriors goalkeeper Elvis Chipezeze was the standout performer for Magesi FC on Tuesday evening, earning the Man of the Match award despite his teams 2-1 loss to Orlando Pirates in the Carling Knockout Tournament quarter-finals.

The defeat saw Magesi crash out of the competition, ending their hopes of defending the title they won last year.

Although his side lost, Chipezeze kept Magesi in contention throughout the first half, pulling off several crucial saves to deny Pirates at least three clear chances, ensuring the match remained goalless at halftime.

The Zimbabwean shot-stopper was eventually beaten five minutes into the second half by Thapelo Morena, who fired a powerful long-range strike to give Pirates the lead.

Chipezeze continued to frustrate the Buccaneers, producing another stunning save in the 60th minute to keep his team in the game. However, Pirates eventually doubled their lead in the 87th minute through Evidence Makgopa to make it 2-0.

Magesi managed to pull one back in stoppage time, but it was too late to change the outcome.

After the match, Chipezeze was voted Man of the Match and walked away with R100,000 in prize money.

Tuesdays accolade marks his second Man of the Match award this season in the tournament, and his sixth overall, including last seasons campaign.

news.title: Mnangagwa warns foreign investors over pollution, labour abuses
news.content:
By Anna Chibamu

President Emmerson Mnangagwa has issued a stern warning to foreign investors, particularly those in the mining sector, adding that government is finalising measures to hold polluters and labour rights violators accountable.

Delivering his State of the Nation Address (SONA) at the new Parliament Building in Mt Hampden on Tuesday, Mnangagwa said authorities will no longer tolerate companies that exploit workers or degrade the environment.

We expect that they will adhere to the Constitution and laws of our country while respecting our people and our culture, Mnangagwa said.

His remarks come amid growing public outrage over the conduct of some foreign-owned mining firms, especially from China, accused of flouting labour laws, underpaying local workers, and causing extensive environmental damage.

In recent years, Zimbabwes investment drive has drawn criticism from communities who say many investors operate with impunity, polluting rivers, creating unsafe working conditions, and offering little benefit to surrounding areas.

Mnangagwas warning signals mounting government pressure on errant investors amid increasing calls for tighter regulation and enforcement in the mining sector, a key pillar of Zimbabwes struggling economy.

Meanwhile, the President said the long-awaited Mines and Minerals Amendment Bill should be completed during the third session of the 10th Parliament.

news.title: Diaspora Insurance HQ opens its arms to all Africans abroad
news.content:
By Own Correspondent

Diaspora Insurance proudly hosted an exclusive Zamalawi Pre-Event Show at its vibrant Birmingham headquarters, theDiaspora InsuranceHouse, to celebrate African unity and identity whilst reinforcing its role as a home for Africans living abroad.

Organised by Lifetime Entertainment, the star-studded event brought together talented Zambian and Malawian musicians, meeting their fans and sponsors, creating an unforgettable celebration of African culture. The line-up included Trimple M, Danny Kaya, Yo Maps, Saint Realest, Chanda Na Kay, Zeze Kingston, Neo, Chile One, Namadingo, and Driemo.Diaspora Insurancebrand ambassador and celebrity musician Exq also attended, adding star power to the presser. Fans, community leaders, and artists from across Africa gathered in a cosy, intimate setting to witness the powerful connection of Africans in the diaspora.

A Warm Welcome from Diaspora Insurance

In his heartfelt welcome remarks, Diaspora Insurance CEO Jeff Madzingo welcomed guests, reinforcing the companys mission of inclusivity and empowerment for Africans everywhere.

This is your home, said Madzingo.

Diaspora Insurance House is not just our head office, it is a home that welcomes all Africans abroad and within the UK. Whether you are from Malawi, Zambia, Zimbabwe, South Africa, Nigeria, or any part of our beautiful continent, you belong here.

Before the meet-and-greet session with fans, the Zamalawi artists toured Diaspora Insurance House, exploring the companys operations and global reach. They were also hosted in the headquarters executive boardroom, where they engaged in professional discussions with staff on how culture and business can collaborate to uplift African communities abroad.

Celebrating African Culture and Cuisine

After meeting fans and completing the press conference formalities, the stars enjoyed a spread of traditional African cuisine and drinks, immersing themselves in the authentic tastes and warmth of home. The atmosphere was filled with laughter, music, and pride, reflectingDiaspora Insurancesmission of unity and cultural celebration.

With operations in 25 African countries,Diaspora Insurancecontinues to provide tailored financial solutions that empower Africans worldwide. Diaspora Insurance House has hosted numerous high-profile events, including appearances by South African singer Kelly Khumalo, Stewart Murisa during his book launch, Benjani Mwaruwari, ZIFA stakeholder engagements, and other cultural showcases. The success of the Zamalawi Pre-Event Show and sponsorship of the main event reaffirm thatDiaspora Insuranceis more than an insurance provider but a true home that opens its arms to all Africans abroad, uniting the continents heartbeat in the heart of Birmingham. With 14 years of solid operations and a track record of hosting stars from sports, music, and social influence, Diaspora Insurance proves it is a fully operational, reputable company with a physical and traceable location.

news.title: Zim traders set to benefit from Grindrod’s Walvis Bay warehouse
news.content:
By Alois Vinga

JSE-listed freight and logistics company, Grindrod Limiteds new Walvis Bay warehouse facility is set to benefit Zimbabwes traders whose goods transit through the close routes.

Built on Grindrods existing 50,000 m premises, the new weatherproof warehouse spans 4,000 m and meets all Safety, Health, Environment, and Quality (SHEQ) standards as outlined by the Namibian Ports Authority (Namport).

This milestone marks a significant collaboration between Grindrod and Namport, aimed at enhancing the ports operational efficiency and positioning Walvis Bay as a resilient and sustainable trade gateway.

Walvis Bay is a strategic alternative for Zimbabwe, which presents opportunities like reduced congestion, faster clearance times, and lower costs. Consignments to Zimbabwe using this route include a variety of goods such as equipment, vehicles, and consumer products like frozen chicken and furniture.

Grindrod Limited Operations Executive, Frans Visser, said Zimbabwe is one of the nations which can reap the low-hanging fruit from the investment.

Walvis Bay is ideally situated as a gateway to global markets, especially for cargo originating from the West Coast of Africa and neighbouring countries such as South Africa, Zambia, Botswana, Malawi, Zimbabwe, and the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), he said.

Andrew Sturrock, CEO of Grindrods Logistics segment, emphasised the strategic importance of this investment.

Our continued infrastructure development in Walvis Bay reflects our commitment to growth and our purpose of making a positive difference in Africas trade with the world. We see this region evolving into a secure and efficient transit corridor, he said.

news.title: Dawn arson, police raid scuttle Biti’s address on Mnangagwa’s term extension bid
news.content:
By Staff Reporter

A planned address by opposition and civic society leaders at the Southern Africa Political Economy Series (SAPES) Trust was abruptly disrupted on Tuesday after Zimbabwe Republic Police (ZRP) anti-riot officers stormed the venue.

Opposition figures Tendai Biti, Job Sikhala, and Jacob Ngarivhume were scheduled to speak on an alleged plot by ZANU PF to extend President Emmerson Mnangagwas term beyond 2028.

In the early hours of Tuesday, the SAPES Trust premises were reportedly petrol-bombed and a guard on duty was abducted, in what is believed to be a coordinated attempt to stop the discussion.

SAPES Trust Director Ibbo Mandaza said there appeared to be a clear link between the arson attack and the subsequent police disruption.

It is not surprising at all. There is a correlation between what happened after midnight,the arson, the abduction of the security guard.

It was done by people who know the job of fear. They seem to have forgotten that we have endured such harassment for the past two years, said Mandaza.

The ruling party has endorsed a resolution seeking to extend Mnangagwas presidency to 2030, which would require amending Section 91(2) of the Constitution, which limits a president to two terms, and Section 328(7), which bars incumbents from benefiting from constitutional amendments.

According to party insiders, ZANU PF intends to use its parliamentary majority to push through the proposed changes.

Speaking at the disrupted event, Biti condemned the attacks and reaffirmed the groups commitment to defending the Constitution.

We are very sorry to Dr. Mandaza over the arson, and to Gilbert Mbwende, whose house was also attacked.

This is a new initiative by concerned citizens to resist the mutilation of the Constitution. It is not a political effort, but a civic one, to defend the rule of law, Biti said.
